tool_description: Search internal memory tiers (short, medium, long-term, and base knowledge) for relevant past conversations and information

available_commands.description: Search all memory tiers for relevant entries matching the query. Returns top 5 results.
Search only short-term memory (recent conversation). Returns top 5 results.
Search medium-term memory (earlier today). Returns top 5 results. Optional date filter (YYYY-MM-DD).
Search long-term memory (past days summaries). Returns top 5 results. Optional date filter (YYYY-MM-DD).
Search base knowledge (personality and documents). Returns top 5 results.

tool_usage_guidance: Use specific search terms like 'minecraft', 'favorite game', 'VTubers' instead of general terms like 'gaming topics' or 'anime discussions'
All search commands return exactly 5 most relevant results (not configurable)
search_short: For very recent context (last few messages) - no date filtering
search_medium: For earlier today's conversations - optional date filter
search_long: For conversations from previous days - optional date filter
search_base: For personality traits, examples, or reference documents - no date filtering
General 'search' command automatically searches all relevant tiers with optional date filter
Date filtering only works for medium and long memory tiers
proactive_triggers: When user says 'remember', 'recall', 'you said', 'we talked about'
When user asks 'what did I tell you about X' (use specific term X)
When user references 'yesterday', 'last time', 'before', 'earlier' with specific topics
When you're uncertain about past context that might be relevant to a specific topic
When user asks about specific topics you might have discussed previously (e.g., 'my favorite game', 'that VTuber I mentioned')

metadata.notes: Integrates with the four-tier memory system. Returns exactly 5 results per query. Supports optional date filtering for medium and long memory. Use specific search terms for best results.
